H0.text: Earplugs are the equipment the X‑ray technician most likely says she uses on a regular basis during her daily work to help ensure patient safety.

H1.text: Rubber gloves are the equipment an X‑ray technician would most likely say she uses on a regular basis to help ensure the safety of patients, as discussed at a career day at school.

H2.text: Goggles are equipment that an X‑ray technician would most likely say she uses on a regular basis to help ensure the safety of patients, as she discussed during a career day at school.

H3.text: Lead aprons are the equipment the X‑ray technician most likely says she uses on a regular basis to help ensure patient safety during her daily work, as described on career day at school.

A4.text: The purpose of the lead apron is to reduce exposure of a hospital patient to x-rays to vital organs that are potentially exposed to ionizing radiation during medical imaging that uses x-rays (radiography, fluoroscopy, computed tomography).

A5.text: A lead apron or leaded apron is a type of protective clothing that acts as a radiation shield.
